div.div: End-User Guide for JPS Calc Application
Here you will learn what addition is.
Here you will find instructions about using the subtraction feature of the JPS Calculator app.
Here you will learn what subtraction is.
Here you will find instructions about using the subtraction feature of the JPS Calculator app.
Here you will learn what multiplication is.
Here you will find instructions about using the multiplication feature of the JPS Calculator app.
Here you will learn what multiplication is.
Here you will find instructions about using the division feature of the JPS Calculator app.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Here you will learn what addition is.
Addition is a mathematical operation; it is a process or action that you do with numbers. Addition allows you to find the sum of 2 numbers.
You use the plus (+) button to express the addition operation in the app.
In the addition process, you take a number and increase it to a larger number. That is, you add one number to another.
Here you will find instructions about using the subtraction feature of the JPS Calculator app.

section.p: To successfully add numbers, you must know addition.
The result from the addition is displayed.

div.section:
You want to add 2 to 3. The equation will look like 3+2=5. You enter 3. Press plus. Enter 2. Press equals.
The result 5 appears on the screen.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Here you will learn what subtraction is.
Subtraction is a mathematical operation; it is a process or action that you do with numbers. Subtraction allows you to find the difference of 2 numbers.
You use the minus (-) button to express the subtraction operation in the app.
In the subtraction process, you take a number and reduce it to a smaller number. That is, you take away one number from another.
Here you will find instructions about using the subtraction feature of the JPS Calculator app.

section.p: To successfully subtract numbers, you must know subtraction.
The result from the subtraction is displayed.

div.section:
You want to subtract 2 from 3. The equation will look like 3-2=1. You enter 3. Press minus. Enter 2. Press equals.
The result 1 appears on the screen.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Here you will learn what multiplication is.
Multiplication is a mathematical operation; it is a process or action that you do with numbers. Multiplication allows you to find the product of 2 numbers.
You use the multiply (×) button to express the multiplication operation in the app.
In the multiplication process, you take a number add it to itself repeatedly a specific number of times. That is, you add a number, with respect to another number, repeatedly.
If you multiply 2 by 3, that means 3 is added to itself two times. For example, 3 + 3 = 6 is the same as 3 × 2 = 6.
Here you will find instructions about using the multiplication feature of the JPS Calculator app.

section.p: To successfully add numbers, you must know multiplication.
The result from the multiplication is displayed.

div.section:
You want to multiply 2 and 3. The equation will look like 3×2=6. You enter 3. Press multiply. Enter 2. Press equals.
The result 6 appears on the screen.

div.domains: (map mapgroup-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic delay-d) a(props deliveryTarget) (map ditavalref-d) (map glossref-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic hi-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic markup-d) (topic pr-d) (topic relmgmt-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic ut-d) (topic markup-d xml-d)

div.p: Here you will learn what multiplication is.
Division is a mathematical operation; it is a process or action that you do with numbers. Division allows you to split a number or an amount into equal parts.
You use the divide (also known as obelus) (÷) button to express the division operation in the app. The result is known as the quotient.
In the division process, a number divided by another number is shared into equal groups.
For example, “6 divided by 3” means “6 shared into 3 equal groups”, which would be 2. This is shown as 6 ÷ 3 = 2.
Here you will find instructions about using the division feature of the JPS Calculator app.

section.p: To successfully divide numbers, you must know division.
The result from the division is displayed.

div.section:
You want to divide 6 by 3. The equation will look like 6÷3=2. You enter 3. Press divide. Enter 2. Press equals.
The result 2 appears on the screen.
